<ashigaru1@...> writes:

> Your expanded description will help me alot in appreciating this 
> blade, and in my self-designed home study course - Nihonto 101, 
> Introduction to the Japanese Sword.  Which somebody should offer at 
> my local community college or Japanese culture center.  

> Thank you again.  I will try to listen [read] more and speak 
> [comment] less.  

Don't speak less... 

It may cut down on opportunities to learn.

Other people disagree strongly with my approach to valuation as well.

Often times on various subjects I have found that when you put forth an
opinion as a statement, people are more prepared to offer up information
in challenge than they would if you put it forth as a question and they
were answering.

That is, if you were having trouble with your Mac, if you said, "Macs
suck because they cannot do XYZ" someone would jump up and tell you that
they could so do XYZ and here's how, than if you did just asking how to
do XYZ on your Mac :-).

- darcy
